position.marginalia_text: Si minerali eligere maluerit, no[n] absq[ue] 472.304:272: et 224, sortietur optatum. Itaq[ue] qui habet aures audiendi, audiat Quonia[m] ip[su]m Arcanum maximu[m] o[mn]ibus benemerentibus notum fieri a[e]quum censuimus. Quicquid eni[m] antiqui Philosophi involutum tenebris et noctis caligine tradiderunt, iam aperte revelavimus. Si quis igitur ad perfectione[m] inventionis tam admirabilis Thesauri omnium maximi pervenerit, per illud maximu[m] Dei nome[n], mortalibus ineffabile ip[su]m obsecramus, atq[ue] eum obtestamur et constringimus, vt illum sincera[e] mentis probitate inviolabiliter custodiat: ne filioru[m] sapientu[m] panem canibus proijciat. Notaru[m] pra[e]dictaru[m] Ostensio

marginalia.translation: Consequently, one with ears to hear hears. Because we suppose that the greatest secret itself is made known to everyone well-deserving. For whatever the old philosophers delivered, wrapped in the warmth of the shadow and night, we have revealed it by now openly. If therefore anyone reached perfection of this so admirable an invention of the thessaurus, the greatest of all, we pray to that greatest name of God, which itself may be uttered by mortals, and we implore him and draw together, so that his name imperishably protexts us by his probity of the sincere sense, lest he throws away the bread of this wise sons to the dogs.
